name: Création de contenu automatisée pour les réseaux sociaux avec OpenAI, approbation LinkedIn et Twitter
description:
Que vous soyez chef de produit, développeur ou simplement curieux de l'automatisation des flux de travail, vous êtes au bon endroit. Ce flux de travail n8n est conçu pour vous aider à rationaliser et automatiser votre création de contenu pour les réseaux sociaux, le processus d'approbation et de publication - le tout avec un minimum d'effort manuel.

J'ai rassemblé ce guide pour vous faciliter la tâche, même si vous êtes nouveau dans n8n ou les outils d'automatisation. Vous trouverez des instructions étape par étape, des liens utiles et des conseils pour garantir une configuration fluide. N'hésitez pas à explorer, expérimenter et à personnaliser ce flux de travail à votre goût !

Plongeons ensemble et débloquons le pouvoir de l'automatisation !

## **1. Ce que fait ce flux de travail**

Ce flux de travail automatise le processus de création, de révision et de publication de publications sur les réseaux sociaux pour LinkedIn et Twitter (X), y compris la génération d'images et les étapes d'approbation. Il notifie également via Slack et enregistre les publications dans Google Sheets.

Flux de travail json : https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1zE5W0Ff6EBoAFRHupWPybC-fnGZqE84r?usp=sharing

## **2. Prérequis**

- Un compte n8n (inscrivez-vous gratuitement : [n8n Cloud](https://app.n8n.cloud/register))
- Identifiants API pour :
    - OpenAI (pour la génération de contenu et d'images)
    - LinkedIn
    - Gmail (pour les e-mails d'approbation)
    - Twitter/X
    - Slack
    - Google Sheets

Vous trouverez de l'aide pour configurer l'authentification à la fin de ce document !

## **3. Comment utiliser ce flux de travail**

### **Étape 1 : Importer le flux de travail**

- Téléchargez ou copiez le JSON du flux de travail.
- Dans n8n, cliquez sur **Importer** et collez/téléchargez le flux de travail.

### **Étape 2 : Configurer les identifiants**

- Pour chaque nœud de service (OpenAI, LinkedIn, Gmail, Twitter, Slack, Google Sheets), cliquez sur le nœud et sélectionnez ou créez les identifiants requis.
- Utilisez les liens de configuration officiels fournis précédemment pour chaque service.

### **Étape 3 : Configurer le déclencheur**

- Le flux de travail commence par un nœud de **Déclencheur de formulaire**. Ouvrez le nœud pour personnaliser les champs du formulaire si nécessaire.

### **Étape 4 : Tester le flux de travail**

- Cliquez sur **Tester le flux de travail** pour l'exécuter manuellement.
- Remplissez le formulaire pour générer une publication.
- Le flux de travail va :
    1. Générer un contenu spécifique à la plateforme en utilisant l'IA.
    2. Envoyer un e-mail d'approbation.
    3. Si approuvé, générer une image (si sélectionné).
    4. Publier sur LinkedIn et Twitter.
    5. Notifier via Slack.
    6. Enregistrer la publication dans Google Sheets.

### **Étape 5 : Réviser et ajuster**

- Vérifiez chaque nœud pour des erreurs ou des identifiants manquants.
- Ajustez les invites de contenu, la logique d'approbation ou le formatage de sortie si nécessaire.

## **4. Ressources utiles n8n**

- [Guide de démarrage rapide n8n](https://docs.n8n.io/getting-started/quickstart/)
- [Comment utiliser les modèles de flux de travail](https://docs.n8n.io/workflows/templates/)
- [Travailler avec des identifiants](https://docs.n8n.io/credentials/)
- [Utiliser des expressions dans n8n](https://docs.n8n.io/code/expressions/)

parameters.subject: =FOR YOUR APPROVAL {{ $('Social Media Content Factory').item.json.output.name }} - {{ $('Social Media Content Factory').item.json.output.description }}

parameters.formTitle: What do you feel like posting about today?

values.placeholder: What is the title or topic you want to write the post about?
Include any specific keywords or hashtags you'd like
=Would you like to redirect your audience to a link? Add it here.

parameters.formDescription:
=Welcome to your Social Media Assistant!

Just provide the topic or title of your choice and an optional image, and the agent will generate platform-specific posts

If you're looking to grow your social media presence, this agent will save you time and make posting efficient.

parameters.content: ## STEP 1 : Generate social media post - text
## STEP 3:  Generate social media post - image or choose an existing image online

parameters.text:
=You are a **content creation AI** for Saloni, a leading creator of **product management careers, growth, leadership** content.

Your goal is to craft **engaging, platform-specific content** for LinkedIn, Twitter (X),. Each post must align with the platform’s audience preferences, tone, and style while reflecting Saloni's expertise. The content should provide **value-driven insights**, tutorials, reviews, and discussions that resonate with tech professionals, product managers, leaders, startup founders and more.

### Key Objectives:
1. **Platform Optimization**: Tailor content format, tone, and hashtags to suit each platform’s algorithm and audience engagement patterns.
2. **SEO & Hashtags**: Use a mix of general automation hashtags and trending platform-specific hashtags to maximize reach.
3. **Engagement Focus**: Create content that sparks interaction through tutorials, comparisons, reviews, or thought-provoking discussions.
4. **Consistency**: Maintain a professional yet approachable tone across all platforms while adapting to audience needs.
5. **Data-Driven Strategy**: Analyze trends and performance data to refine content strategy and hashtag usage.

### General Hashtags:
#WomenInTech #ProductManagement

---
You have to generate content both for Linkedin and Twitter as mentioned below

### Platform-Specific Guidelines:

#### 1. LinkedIn
   - **Style**: Professional and insightful.
   - **Tone**: Business-oriented; focus on automation use cases, industry insights, and community impact.
   - **Content Length**: 3-4 sentences; concise but detailed.
   - **Hashtags**: #ProductManagement #WomenInTech
   - **Call to Action (CTA)**: Follow Saloni Malhotra for everything Product.


#### 2. Twitter (X)
   - **Style**: Concise and impactful.
   - **Tone**: Crisp and engaging
   - **Hashtags**: #ProductManagement #WomenInTech
   - **CTA**: Drive quick engagement through retweets or replies (e.g., “What’s your go-to n8n workflow?”).


---

### Content Creation Workflow:
For every post:
1. Use the following input fields:
    - Topic/About the Post: {{ $json.Topic }}
    - Keywords/Focus Areas: {{ $json.formMode }}
    - Link (optional): {{ $json['Link (optional)'] }}
	
2. Adapt the tone/style given below for each post and Ensure every post reflects this tone
Thoughtful, yet Playful
You dive deep into product management, tech, and career stuff, but you make it digestible. Even heavy topics like supply chain systems or Gini coefficients come with a wink. You never talk down to the reader, but you don’t dumb things down either.

Honest and Self-aware
You don’t pretend to have it all figured out. You’re open about things like burnout, privilege, career plateaus, or learning curves. That makes your content feel real, not performative.

Confident without being boastful
You showcase your wins—leading a GenAI solution, shipping customer portals, launching Dot—but your tone says “Here’s what I learned”, not “Look how amazing I am.”

Conversational but Structured
Your posts often follow a structure—hook, insight, story, takeaway—but you write like you talk: sharp, witty, humane. Even when you rant, it feels like a smart friend venting over chai, not noise for engagement.


Linkedin post should be about 500 words and twitter post under 150 characters

Follow the provided JSON schema for your reponse.

options.systemMessage: =Use the provided tools to research the topic based on latest information.  Todays date is {{ $now }}

parameters.text:
=Generate clean, modern HTML email content from the provided JSON data with these requirements: - Use table-based layout with inline CSS for email compatibility - Create card sections for each platform containing: • Title header (20px) • Post content (16px) • Video/image suggestions (italic 14px) • Hashtag list (inline-block with # prefix) • Emoji preservation where present • Call-to-action (bold 14px) - Structure using: • 600px max-width container • 20px padding between cards • Left-aligned text hierarchy • Arial/sans-serif font stack • Email-safe colors (#333 text, #555 secondary) - Include all platform-specific elements: ▶ Video/image suggestions in italic ▶ Hashtags as linked search terms ▶ Emojis in original positions ▶ Character limits for Twitter ▶ Platform-specific CTAs ▶ Visual quality reminders - Format hashtags as: #tag Input data: {{ $json.output.toJsonString() }} Remove ALL code blocks and comments. Output ONLY the raw HTML with: - Platform cards in JSON order - All data elements represented - Mobile-responsive tables - W3C-valid markup ## Example HTML:

LinkedIn
Follow Saloni Malhotra on Linkedin for everything Product.
Video/Image suggestion pending
#ProductManagement #WomenInTech
Checkout my Linkedin profile https://www.linkedin.com/in/saloni-malhotra/ and follow my Instagram page at that_product_girl!
Twitter
Checkout my Linkedin profile https://www.linkedin.com/in/saloni-malhotra/ and follow my Instagram page at that_product_girl!
#WomenInTech #ProductManagement #VibeCoding

parameters.content:
## From Idea to Post: Social Media Automation in Action


Instead of manually writing content, emailing for approval, designing creatives, and posting—this workflow does it all for you. It’s perfect for:

Founders or marketers who want to save time

Teams that need content approval before publishing

Ensuring consistent quality and branding across posts

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
